The results of the predicted probabilities of HFRS occurrence showed that cultivated land had the highest occurrence of HFRS among all land types in both 2014 and 2015. Grassland and built-on land showed a moderate or low risk of HFRS, and forest and water bodies had a low risk ( Table 2). The Pearson correlation analysis revealed that R
0t was closely correlated with R
00 : r = 0.96 (P<0.01, n = 10) and R 2 = 0.93. Thus, our prediction was able to reliably reflect the proportion of HFRS occurrences among the different land-use types.
